title: How to Turn Off Offload Unused Apps: Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray gears icon on your iPhone or iPad home screen.

steps.title: Tap App Store.
steps.content: Tap App Store . It’s next to an icon with a white “A” on a blue background. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to “Offload Unused Apps”.
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to “Offload Unused Apps”. This will turn off the Offload Unused Apps feature for your iPhone or iPad. The toggle should be gray and in the left position. [2] X Research source If you want to get rid of a few apps, check out how to delete an iPhone app. You can always redownload them from the iPhone App Store .

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray gears icon on your iPhone or iPad home screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . This option has a light gray gear icon on a dark gray background. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap iPhone Storage.
steps.content: Tap iPhone Storage . This will open a new page showing your device's storage capacity and distribution. Note that this button will be called iPad Storage if you're on an iPad. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the app you want to offload.
steps.content: Tap the app you want to offload. This will open a page showing the app's details.

steps.title: Tap Offload App on the app's page.
steps.content: Tap Offload App on the app's page. This will offload the app from your device. The app itself will be deleted, giving you more storage space, but its data and documents will remain installed. This allows you to reinstall the app later and retain the same settings and data. [6] X Research source
